content:
Validator 3 had a newline after the number and I lost this on shortest mode just now because of it. :(

So annoying. When you submit shortest mode, please be careful with accidental newlines. I will try to edit the validator now.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The problem statement is easy to understand, and I think that most players can find an initial solution fast enough to allow for tinkering with code size afterwards. I'm interested in seeing what kinds of tricks people use to generate the desired indices!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: This is an interesting exercise and suitable for the "Code Size" mode.

Goal section
* Please mention that index starts from 0 (as it is not always the case for some programming languages).

Constraints section
* That upper limit is way overstated and who bothers to count the number of zeros in it. Please just state 10**20 or some other reasonable number.

Thanks.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I approve this exercise because it's straightforward, doesn't have any unnecessary information, and it's a good fit for the type "code size".
thank you for your comment, I will rectify now

Ok, it's fixed now. So annoying when validators have silly issues like this and you get 100% on test cases but can't know whether your shortest code will pass the validators or not.
Good puzzle otherwise.

Just fixed another issue with the constraint, it said:
1 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 10**20

But the tests are much smaller range so I changed to:
1000 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 10**9

This is important because dealing with [[N]]<1000 could cost extra characters in Shortest mode.

Thank you.

Please remove ">=0" in Input section. It is not needed because it has been mentioned in Constraints section.

Just in case of misunderstanding, my previous comment refers to the index of a string. You may add a sentence in Goal section like this:

Given a positive integer [[N]], display the product of the digits whose index is divisible by 3. Indexing starts from {{0}}, so the leftmost digit is of index 0, the next digit is of index 1, etc.

Thanks.
Thank you for your comment and your involvement on Coding Game, it really helps to produce better content.

Thank you for your kind words :)

Please note that after your latest revisions:
* Input section states that N is a positive integer.
* Constraints section states that N may be zero.

If N is zero, it is not positive. Hence, you may have to change 0 ≤ N ≤ 10**20 as 1 ≤ N ≤ 10**20 or 0 < N ≤ 10**20.

Thanks again.
